title: Question 23
prompt: Mrs. Sloane announced to her class, <u>"Students, the algebra exam will be given on Friday."</u>  All of the students were relieved to hear that it was postponed.
description: Read the following sentences and look at the underlined parts.  Choose the answer that is written correctly for each underlined part.
feedback: The sentence is correct as it is. The word “students” does not need an apostrophe.  Apostrophes are used to indicate possession. For example, you would add an apostrophe and the letter ‘s’ to a singular noun that doesn’t end in ‘s’ to show possession. For example, you would write, “the man’s boat.” The example in this question does not show possession, and so an apostrophe is not needed. It is a plural noun addressing the class. The answer choices that capitalize “algebra” and “exam” are also incorrect. The words “algebra” and “exam” are not proper nouns and do not need to be capitalized.
